page.title: 13GOMERIAN PRESS
page.content: This is the oldest business in Llandysul, and was established in 1896 to undertake the printing of books, posters and pamphlets. It now employs 40 people and operates a newsagent shop and delivers newspapers within a 3 mile radius. Although it undertakes the printing of community newspapers, posters, tickets etc, its main work is concerned with the printing of books, porticualy in{Welsh.}It does a great deal of work for the{Local Education {Authority}supplying all the schools in Dyfed with the majority of their text books, and also some of the libraries. Much of the work they do, and material published, is aimed at fostering the Welsh language and arresting its decline. They print a number of items for the{National Eisteddfod,}e.g.the confidential list of winners in the {Crown}and{Chair}bardic competitions.
